availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mark A. Smith (Trigg County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and grocer.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and grocer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Torian in Trigg County, Kentucky, on April 29, 1846. Father of Anna A. Smith, Hetta Smith, and Guss Smith. Cabinetmaker in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Retired grocer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Grocer in Trigg County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 292A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 187.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 391A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 48B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Trigg County, KY, June 1863, p. 21.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335, p. 108.
"Mark A Smith (1824-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial 50932898, accessed April 17, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50932898.
